definition: to make (something, such as pain or suffering) more bearable
examples: a drug that alleviates the symptoms
using relaxation techniques to alleviate stress
To draw customers, [Richard G.] Rosenberg became certified in pedorthics—an area that involves the design, make and modification of shoes to alleviate foot ailments.

definition: to partially remove or correct (something undesirable)
examples: Enticing retirees into the work force to alleviate the current labor shortage …
